meanings.definition: To call upon (a deity, spirit, etc.) for aid, protection, inspiration, or the like.
meanings.sent1: During the storm, the villagers invocate the ancient gods for protection.
meanings.sent2: The poet would often invocate the muse before beginning to write.
meanings.sent3: In the play, the character comically invocates a mischievous spirit for help.
meanings.sent4: The coach invocated the team spirit to inspire the players before the championship game.
meanings.sent5: The child invocated the bravery of their favorite hero to face their fears.

meanings.definition: To appeal to or cite in support or justification.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer will invocate the new law to defend her client in court.
meanings.sent2: She always invocates her past experiences to guide her decisions.
meanings.sent3: The student humorously invocated a famous quote to justify being late to class.
meanings.sent4: The politician invocated the principles of justice to gain public trust.
meanings.sent5: The teacher invocated the importance of education to motivate her students.

meanings.definition: To petition for help or support.
meanings.sent1: The community will invocate the council for assistance after the flood.
meanings.sent2: They invocated their friends for help when organizing the event.
meanings.sent3: The cat amusingly invocated its owner for more treats by meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: The activist invocated the public to join the cause for environmental protection.
meanings.sent5: The hiker invocated fellow climbers for support during the challenging ascent.
